comment: While she does only speak in Spanish for this class, it actually did help with my understanding of it. You will have to work for your A in this class but the payoff is worth it. I genuinely enjoyed this class.

Prof Webb is a really good Spanish professor! She speaks mostly Spanish but will bend over backwards to make sure you understand the material. She gives lots of resources to help and makes the class fun! Attendance is mandatory & make sure you do all the connect homework! tests are fairly easy as well.
Take Mrs. Webb!!! The whole class is spoken in Spanish but the quizzes and test are straight forward she gives practice test before. Group projects that are easy! Take her.

Professor Webb truly has a love for Spanish and teaching Spanish. If you took Spanish in high school, it helps, however the entire class is spoken in Spanish. She does however give plenty of examples for you to understand the language without using English. The tests and quizzes are somewhat difficult, however if you put in the time you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Hands down the best Spanish teacher I have ever had. She does speak Spanish throughout the entirety of class, but its not as hard as it seems. I really like how she also teaches you about Spanish culture rather than just the language itself. Her projects are made so that its almost impossible to make a bad grade. Im very sad she doesn't teach 2001!

One of the meanest and rudest teachers I have ever had! Not only does she speak all spanish in a beginner spanish class, she won't explain it in english if you ask her for clarification. Extremely rude and wont help you if you ask for help. Was super nice until drop period was over, then turned evil. Class had 35 at beginning, ended with 7 people.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Prof Webb was a very good teacher. There is a lot of in class participation and she makes the lectures fairly interactive. There is a solid bit of homework, but hardly any papers or reports
She's really caring and willing to help you if you don't understand, but you do actually have to do the homework and pay attention to succeed.
